document_metadata.title: Industrial & Education Templates with Measurement Assumptions & Derivation Formulas
document_metadata.purpose: Comprehensive template package with sector-specific measurement assumptions, productivity standards, waste factors, and NRM mapping for 6 industrial + 3 education building types
document_metadata.standards_reference: Australian Standards (AS 1684, AS 3740), NCC 2022 (Volumes 1-2), Masonry Contractors Australia Productivity Guide, Rawlinsons Construction Handbook 2025
key_innovations: Hybrid sizing for industrial templates (length × width × height volume-based calculations)
Explicit waste factors in all derivations (Australian industry standard)
Ceiling height variance by building type and structural system
Education-specific safety compliance (NCC Part 10, accessibility enhancements)
Conservative productivity rates with gang size modifiers
Non-linear item mapping (loading docks, mezzanines, bathrooms per student ratio)

industrial_templates.name: Small Warehouse
industrial_templates.description: Single storey small warehouse, 400m² GFA, metal cladding on steel frame, metal deck roof

specifications.construction_notes: Insulated metal cladding on steel portal frame

measurement_assumptions.method: Length × Width × Height approach for large-volume industrial items

example_dimensions.justification: Standard warehouse footprint (400 m² ÷ 20m width = 20m length); clear height 6.0m accommodates pallet racking (1.5m per tier, ~3 tiers) plus maintenance clearance

measurement_assumptions.ceiling_height_justification: 6.0m typical for single-storey warehouses with pallet racking (AS 1684 Part 2 coordination); lower than large warehouses (7.5m) due to smaller footprint and simpler span structures
measurement_assumptions.ncc_compliance: NCC Class 7 (industrial storage); height determined by racking requirement, not habitable room minimums

productivity_rates.characteristics: Metal cladding + steel frame = rapid assembly, repetitive work, minimal site adjustment

metal_cladding_installation.notes: 18-20 m²/8-hour day; repetitive cladding panels, pre-assembled

steel_frame_erection.notes: Portal frames pre-fabricated; rapid bolting/welding on-site

concrete_slab_finishing.notes: Broom finish (non-slip); lower precision than residential

metal_roof_installation.notes: Metal deck + colorbond sheets; 15-18 m²/8-hour day

productivity_rates.gang_composition_modifier: Industrial projects favour smaller, more efficient teams (2-3 person) vs residential (3-person baseline). Productivity multiplier: 1.05 (5% faster due to repetitive work)

waste_factors.section: 3 - Material Waste (May Be Lower for Steel, Higher for Concrete)
waste_factors.characteristics: Steel structures: minimal waste (prefabricated); Concrete: variable depending on formwork reuse

concrete.reason: Spillage, over-excavation, pump residue (concrete slab may have excess due to site settling)

steel_frame.reason: Minimal waste for prefabricated portal frames; 5% allows for cutting adjustments on-site
steel_frame.derivation_example: 25 tonne portal frame requirement × 1.05 (5% waste) = 26.25 tonne

metal_cladding.derivation_example: Wall area 240m² (perimeter 80m × 6.0m height, includes roof overhang adjustments) × 1.06 (6% waste) = 254.4 m² panels required

metal_roofing.reason: Overlap allowance (at least 2 ribs), colour matching waste
metal_roofing.derivation_example: Roof area (GFA 400m² × 1.15 roof factor) = 460 m² × 1.05 (5% waste) = 483 m²

non_linear_items.section: 4 - Non-Linear Items (Items NOT Measured by GFA)
non_linear_items.definition: Industrial items counted by unit or as absolute quantities rather than area-based

items.typical_specification: Single dock 3.5m wide × 10m deep staging area; reinforced concrete, dock leveller, safety barriers
items.quantity_derivation: 1 dock (single-storey 400m² warehouse typically requires 1 dock for operations; larger warehouses would require 2+)
items.notes: Not proportional to GFA; determined by throughput requirements and building frontage

items.typical_specification: Concrete apron with sloped drainage to stormwater; perimeter = √(400×4) × 1.2 = ~40m
items.quantity_derivation: 40m perimeter × 3.0m apron depth = 120 m² (section 8.3 external drainage)
items.notes: Critical for warehouse to prevent water ingress; slope typically 1:200 minimum

items.typical_specification: 100-150 m² mezzanine level for office/storage; steel frame + decking
items.quantity_derivation: If included: 120 m² mezzanine (30% of GFA); does NOT affect GFA calculation (measured once on ground level)
items.notes: Optional structural enhancement; common in smaller warehouses for vertical storage optimization

soil_conditions_impact.context: Small warehouse on slab-on-ground; foundation cost heavily influenced by soil bearing capacity

assessment_factors.interpretation: Soil bearing 1:1.3 worse than clay baseline; may require imported fill, additional compaction, proof rolling

sand_site.cost_impact: Faster excavation but wider/deeper footings; increased concrete volume +25%

mixed_fill_site.cost_impact: Higher labour (proof rolling, inspection); imported fill +15% material cost; recommend soil test report

formulas.notes: Conservative estimate for rectilinear building; actual measurement may be 40-50m
Used for cladding takeoff; no waste factor applied (accounts for overlaps in panel specification)

formulas.calculation: 288 m² × 1.06 = 305.3 m² (plus roof fascia/soffit ~20 m²) = ~325 m² total cladding ordered
formulas.notes: 6% waste covers overlap joints (minimum 150mm), end-of-run cuts, damage allowance
Metal deck roof with 1:8 pitch = ~1.08 actual slope factor; added 1.15 for eaves overhang (0.5m all sides)
5% waste covers overlap, colour matching across sheets, edge/ridge caps
Industrial floor slab 150mm standard; waste accounts for over-pour, pump residue, edge finishing

formulas.formula: GFA ÷ 4 m² (commercial ratio per NCC F5)
formulas.notes: Industrial building requires 1 point per 4m² (higher density than residential 1:6); distributed across warehouse zone + office areas
Industrial standard 3m apron for vehicle/equipment access; reinforced (SL82 mesh)

requirements.egress: Two exits minimum, separated by 1/3 diagonal distance; exit doors minimum 1.0m × 2.1m height
requirements.lighting: 50 lux minimum on main aisles, 30 lux in storage zones (AS/NZS 1680.1)
requirements.ventilation: 6-8 air changes per hour or CO2 sensors if gas storage (AS 1684 coordination with hazardous goods if applicable)
requirements.fire_safety: Sprinklers required if building >2,000 m² (this 400 m² may be exempt; verify local council)
requirements.racking_safety: All pallet racking must be professionally installed per AS 4084 (industrial storage); qualified independent inspector certification

safety_accessibility_standards.no_enhanced_accessibility_required: Class 7 industrial storage facilities are not public areas; accessibility requirements per NCC Part D apply only to staff facilities (staff rooms, WCs, office areas). Main warehouse storage zones are work areas, not accessible public spaces.

nrm_mapping_summary.section: 8 - NRM Section Breakdown for Industrial Warehouses

nrm_allocation.items: Site setup, temporary fencing, demolition (if applicable), environmental works
Excavation (50 m³ in mixed soil), concrete slab 63 m³, reinforcement, formwork
Steel portal frame (25 tonne), roof trusses/purlins, metal cladding, metal roof covering, gutters/downpipes
Internal wall finishes (office areas only ~50 m²), ceiling finishes (commercial paint on underside of roof deck), floor finishes (sealed concrete)
Office built-ins, racking (if supply-only, not installation)
Electrical (100 power points, 20 light points, switchboard), plumbing (staff WC, sink), HVAC (basic ventilation), fire safety (manual extinguishers)
Sectional doors (loading), manual/electric roller doors
N/A (new build)
Site drainage (144 m² apron), paving (car park), landscaping, external services (stormwater)

structural_system_notes.section: 9 - Structural System Coordination & Ceiling Height Justification
structural_system_notes.system_type: Steel portal frame with metal deck roof

ceiling_height_derivation.rack_configuration: Standard racking dimensions: 1.5m bay width × 1.5m tier height × 1.5m depth = 3 tiers per stack = 4.5m total stack height plus 0.5m for handling = 5.0m minimum usable height
ceiling_height_derivation.building_height_selection: 6.0m clear height chosen to accommodate 3-tier pallet racking + 1.0m clearance above stacks for equipment clearance + 0.5m for mechanical/electrical services above ceiling line = 7.5m from slab to eaves (design floor-to-beam = 6.0m clear)
ceiling_height_derivation.frame_coordination: Portal frame span 20m × bay 5m modules; roof pitch 1:8 = 2.5m height change over 20m span; structural engineer determines exact eaves height based on racking load case (typically 25 kN/m² distributed load per tier)

industrial_templates.name: Medium Warehouse
industrial_templates.description: Single storey medium warehouse, 800m² GFA, metal cladding on steel frame, metal deck roof

specifications.construction_notes: Insulated metal cladding on steel portal frame

measurement_assumptions.method: Length × Width × Height approach; typical grid 32m × 25m = 800m²

example_dimensions.justification: Medium warehouse footprint; single-span portal frame 32m, depth 25m accommodates 3-bay loading dock configuration

measurement_assumptions.ceiling_height_justification: 6.0m consistent with small warehouse; adequate for 3-tier racking but lower than large warehouses (7.5m) due to handling efficiency trade-off (smaller footprint = less distance to move goods)

productivity_rates.section: 2 - Industrial Productivity (Repetitive Work, Larger Gang Efficiency)
productivity_rates.characteristics: Larger warehouse scale enables 3-4 person teams for steel erection; productivity gains from repetition

steel_frame_erection.notes: 32m clear span frame; increased efficiency from larger project scale; 3-person team (2 erectors + 1 assistant)

metal_cladding_installation.notes: 20-22 m²/8-hour day; 2-3 person team improves efficiency vs single installer

concrete_slab_finishing.notes: 2-person finishing team on 800m² slab; broom finish
concrete_slab_finishing.source: Larger slab area = more efficient (fewer edge/corner transitions)

productivity_rates.gang_composition_modifier: Larger project size enables 3-4 person teams with +10% productivity multiplier vs baseline

steel_frame.reason: Larger frame = slightly less waste proportionally; 5% allows for adjustment cuts

metal_cladding.reason: 800m² wall area increases scrap management; 6% waste

items.quantity_derivation: 2-3 docks for medium warehouse (one dock per 400 m²); 3 docks × (3.5m wide × 10m deep) = 3 dock positions
200-250 m² mezzanine optional (25-30% of GFA); common for office/admin space above receiving area

assessment_factors.excavation_volume: Perimeter 56m × 0.45m × 0.30m = 7.56 m³ (smaller per-unit waste than small warehouse)

safety_accessibility_standards.requirements: Same as small warehouse; multiple dock exits required per NCC E2.2

nrm_mapping_summary.summary: Similar allocation percentages to small warehouse; substructure higher (126 m³ concrete vs 63 m³)

structural_system_notes.section: 9 - Structural System (32m Clear Span Portal Frame)
structural_system_notes.ceiling_height_derivation: 6.0m clear height; same racking config as small warehouse but over 800m² floor = better space utilization

industrial_templates.name: Large Warehouse
industrial_templates.description: Single storey large warehouse, 2000m² GFA, metal cladding on steel frame, metal deck roof

specifications.construction_notes: Insulated metal cladding on steel portal frame

example_dimensions.justification: Large warehouse typical grid; 50m single span or 2×25m spans, 40m depth; GFA 2000m² = 50m × 40m

measurement_assumptions.ceiling_height_justification: 7.5m clear height accommodates 4-tier high-density pallet racking (1.5m × 4 tiers = 6.0m + 1.0m topload clearance + 0.5m services) or reach-truck operation (specialized equipment with higher clearance requirements)

steel_frame_erection.notes: 50m span frame; larger projects achieve higher daily output; 4-person team (3 erectors + 1 assistant)

concrete_slab_finishing.notes: 2000m² slab; larger continuous area = efficiency gains; multiple finisher teams working in parallel zones

waste_factors.note: Same factors as medium/small; large project scale may enable slight economies on waste (1.04-1.05 for steel) but using 1.05 conservative

items.quantity_derivation: 5-6 dock doors for 2000 m² warehouse (typical: 1 dock per 400 m²); recommend minimum 6 docks
500-600 m² mezzanine (25-30% of GFA) above office/receiving areas

structural_system_notes.section: 9 - Structural System (50m Span Portal or Twin-Span)
structural_system_notes.ceiling_height_derivation: 7.5m clear = 4-tier racking support; larger span (50m) requires higher eaves to manage deflection visibility and clearance distribution

industrial_templates.name: Small Workshop
industrial_templates.description: Single storey small workshop, 200m² GFA, metal cladding on steel frame, metal deck roof

specifications.construction_notes: Insulated metal cladding on steel frame

example_dimensions.justification: Smaller workshop footprint; 16m span portal frame, 12.5m depth = 200m² GFA; 5.0m clear height adequate for equipment benches, machine tools, no racking

measurement_assumptions.ceiling_height_justification: 5.0m minimum for workshop equipment clearance (lathes, mills, presses typically 2-3m height); lower than warehouses (no racking); sufficient for monorail/hoist operation (1-2 tonne typical workshop capacity)

productivity_rates.characteristics: Similar to warehouse but smaller; tight gangways, equipment placement requires more precision

steel_frame_erection.notes: Smaller frame; 2-person team (1 erector + 1 assistant) typical for 200 m² workshop

concrete_slab_finishing.notes: Workshop floors require better finish (trowel or sealed) vs warehouse broom finish; allows spill containment

items.quantity_derivation: 1 sliding door (3.5m wide × 3.5m high) + 1 personnel door (1.0m × 2.1m)
Perimeter ≈ 40m × 2.0m apron = 80 m² (workshop requires floor drains + spill containment if chemicals stored)

formulas.calculation: 200 m² × 0.15m × 1.05 = 31.5 m³ concrete (may need 100mm wear coat in high-traffic areas)

structural_system_notes.ceiling_height_derivation: 5.0m clear = adequate for 2-tonne monorail hoist (beam height 0.5m + hook clearance 0.5m = 1.0m overhead) = 5.0m total provides 3.5m working height below services

industrial_templates.name: Medium Workshop
industrial_templates.description: Single storey medium workshop, 500m² GFA, metal cladding on steel frame, metal deck roof

specifications.construction_notes: Insulated metal cladding on steel frame

example_dimensions.justification: Medium workshop; 25m span, 20m depth = 500m² GFA; 5.5m clear height allows slightly larger equipment and multi-tier mezzanine office above receiving area

formulas.calculation: 500 m² × 0.15m + 500 m² × 0.05m (50mm wear coat in machinery areas) × 1.05 = 52.5 m³

industrial_templates.name: Light Industrial Unit
industrial_templates.description: Single storey light industrial unit, 300m² GFA, metal cladding on steel frame, metal deck roof

specifications.construction_notes: Insulated metal cladding on steel frame

example_dimensions.justification: Light industrial (manufacturing, assembly, light fabrication); 20m span, 15m depth = 300m² GFA; 5.0m clear height adequate for benches and light equipment

education_templates.name: Childcare Centre
education_templates.description: Single storey childcare centre, 400m² GFA, brick veneer, tile roof, slab on ground

specifications.construction_notes: 110mm face brick + 40mm cavity + 90mm timber frame + 10mm plasterboard

measurement_assumptions.method: Educational buildings measured by room function, not just GFA; childcare has strict space-per-child requirements (NCC Class 8)

infant_room.requirement: NCC Childcare Guidelines: minimum 3.25 m² per child (play area) + 2.0 m² per staff = 22-26 m² minimum + outdoor access

toddler_room.requirement: 2.5 m² per child (more mobile, less supervision) + 2.0 m² per staff = 32-40 m² minimum

preschool_room.requirement: 2.5 m² per child + 2.0 m² per staff = 48-57 m² minimum

kitchen_food_prep.notes: Commercial kitchen for meal preparation; separate hand-washing, food storage

bathrooms_toilets.ratio: NCC requires 1 WC per 10 children + 1 per staff = 4-5 WCs total; each child WC ~0.8m height (stepped stool accessible)
bathrooms_toilets.accessibility: 1 adult WC, 4 child WCs, hand basins to ADA height (height 0.85m, reach depth 0.4m)

nappy_change.notes: Dedicated nappy change area with wash basin, storage for supplies; MUST be visible to supervising staff (sightlines to play area)

admin_office.notes: Staff office, records, communication with families

hallway_circulation.notes: Circulation space, entry foyer, safe transition zones

productivity_rates.section: 2 - Education Productivity (Similar to Residential But with Fit-Out Precision)
productivity_rates.characteristics: Childcare centres require higher finish quality + safety features vs standard residential; productivity rates are 5-10% slower due to compliance documentation and safety testing

brick_veneer_walls.notes: Slower than standard 5.78 m²/day (5% reduction) due to door/window coordination for childcare safety requirements (wider frames, window guards, corner protection)
brick_veneer_walls.source: Masonry Contractors Australia (adjusted for education fit-out)

plasterboard_fixing.notes: Slightly slower than standard 40-60 m²/day due to junction details around higher handrails, grab bars, impact protection

tile_flooring.notes: Non-slip tile specification (R10+ slip rating); slower due to substrate prep, grouting, sealing
tile_flooring.source: STANDARDS-REFERENCE.md - tiling: 20 m²/day baseline, -10% for childcare safety specs

painting.notes: 16 m²/8-hour day; lower than standard 20 m²/day because low-VOC paints used (slower drying, multiple thin coats per AS 1580 for childcare air quality)

productivity_rates.gang_composition_modifier: Childcare fit-out requires supervisory coordination (safety testing, compliance inspections); suggest +15% labour cost (coordinator/supervisor overhead)

plasterboard.reason: Offcuts around door/window openings for grab bars, safety guards

floor_tiles.reason: Non-slip tile specification; cut-ins for drain grates, transitions

paint.reason: Coverage rates include application method (low-VOC = higher coverage efficiency)

items.formula: 1 WC per 10 children + 1 per staff = (40 children estimated capacity) ÷ 10 + 8 staff ÷ 2 = 4 WCs + 4 hand basins (child height) + 2 WCs (adult height) = 6 WC suites total + 2 adult hand basins
items.notes: Childcare WCs 0.8m height with stepped stool access; separate toilet blocks for each age group (infant/toddler/preschool) reduces supervision issues

items.formula: 3 child rooms × 2 basins/room + 2 basins in kitchen + 2 basins in toilet blocks = 9 hand basins minimum (all with height adjustability per NCC F4)

items.measurement_basis: Linear metres of grab rails, protective barriers
items.formula: Perimeter of playrooms (3 rooms) = ~60m perimeter × 0.9m handrail height; plus corner protection, stair handrails (if any, typically not in single-storey childcare) = ~60-70m total safety equipment
items.notes: Impact protection for corners (foam padding), colour-coded safety edges on doors

items.formula: NCC Childcare: 7 m² per child outdoor play area minimum; 40-child centre = 280 m² outdoor minimum; typical 400 m² building has ~200-250 m² outdoor yard
items.notes: Fencing 1.2m minimum (safety requirement), fall-safe surfacing (engineered mulch or rubber, 300mm depth for equipment heights), no sharp edges, sun protection (shade sails)

safety_accessibility_standards.section: 7 - Safety & Accessibility (NCC Class 8 - Education, Enhanced Standards)
safety_accessibility_standards.ncc_reference: NCC 2022, Part 10 (Housing Provisions apply to Class 8 childcare) + Part D (Access & Mobility) + Part 9 (Fire Safety)

key_requirements.occupant_load: 1 person per 2.5 m² (childcare play areas) per NCC F2.3; 400 m² = max 160 occupants (staff + children + visitors)
key_requirements.exit_requirements: Minimum 2 exits from each room >75 m²; doors minimum 1.0m wide, 2.1m height (nursery doors allow 0.9m width if only exit to secure area)
key_requirements.emergency_lighting: Exit signs + emergency lighting (3-watt minimum per exit) per NCC F4.8
key_requirements.accessibility_enhanced: Beyond standard NCC - many childcare centres comply with AS 1428 (Design for access and mobility) voluntarily for parent/carer accessibility and inclusive design

childcare_specific_safety.window_safety: Windows above 1.2m height must have restrictor bars or safety film per NCC F2.10 (falls prevention for young children); all windows >1.2m below sill height require protection or building exterior design prevents access (e.g., high fence, setback)
childcare_specific_safety.balustrade_height: 1.1m minimum (higher than residential 1.0m) to prevent climbing; no gaps >100mm between balusters per AS 1170.1 (wind loads on high-sided structures)
childcare_specific_safety.door_safety: Slow-closing hinges on all doors (prevents finger trapping); safety glass or film on all large glass panels accessible to children <1.4m height
childcare_specific_safety.surface_finishes: Low-VOC finishes for air quality (AS 1580 low-VOC specification); impact-resistant corner guards (foam, rubber, colour-coded)
childcare_specific_safety.water_safety: Basins, toilets accessible but with restrictors on hot water supply (AS 1357 - max 45°C at tap); drain covers in floor areas (no entrapment hazards)
childcare_specific_safety.electrical_safety: Power points above 1.8m height or with safety shutters per NCC Section 5.4; no extension cords in children's areas

safety_accessibility_standards.compliance_documentation: Building must obtain Fire Safety Certificate (FSC) from Fire Commissioner before operation; includes evacuation procedures, assembly points, roll-check lists, staff training records

formulas.notes: Childcare rooflines typically pitched (1:8 to 1:6); wall area affected by rake/soffit design

formulas.calculation: Internal walls ~100m running length × 2.7m × 2-sided = 540 m² + Ceiling 400 m² = 940 m² × 1.10 = 1034 m² plasterboard sheets

formulas.formula: GFA × 1.10 (10% waste - non-slip specification has higher cut-in rate)
Wall area + ceiling area; low-VOC covers 6-8 m²/litre (vs 8-12 m²/litre standard paint)
formulas.calculation: 540 m² walls + 400 m² ceiling = 940 m² ÷ 7 m²/litre (conservative) = 134 litres low-VOC paint (interior)

nrm_allocation.items: Site setup, temporary fencing (child safety during construction)
Excavation, concrete slab 63 m³, reinforcement
Timber frame, brick veneer walls, roof trusses, tile roof, gutters, safety parapets
Plasterboard walls/ceilings, non-slip floor tiles (all wet areas), paint (low-VOC), skirting/trim
Kitchen fittings (food prep bench), storage cabinetry, hand basins (custom heights), safety barriers/handrails, doors/frames

Electrical (higher density: 1 point per 4 m² due to equipment needs), plumbing (6 WCs + 9+ basins), HVAC (ventilation for air quality), water heating (warm showers), gas (kitchen cooking) if applicable
Sectional doors (utility entry), none typical for childcare
N/A (new build)
Outdoor play area paving/surfacing (280+ m²), fencing (1.2m safety fence, ~200m perimeter), landscaping (shade trees, soft edges), drainage

structural_system_notes.section: 9 - Structural System (Timber Frame, Pitched Roof) & Ceiling Height
structural_system_notes.ceiling_height_derivation: 2.7m clear height is NCC minimum for non-habitable rooms (childcare classified as educational, not habitable per NCC Volume 2); 2.7m adequate for children (average 6-year-old ~1.2m tall) + standing staff = clear sight lines, no oppressive feeling

education_templates.name: Classroom Block
education_templates.description: Single storey classroom block, 600m² GFA, brick veneer, tile roof, slab on ground

specifications.construction_notes: 110mm face brick + 40mm cavity + 90mm timber frame + 10mm plasterboard

measurement_assumptions.method: School classroom blocks measured by educational program space requirements, not just GFA

standard_classroom.requirement: NCC Class 8 Education: minimum 2.0 m² per student (teaching wall + movable furniture) = 50-60 m² minimum per classroom; desk 0.65m × 0.45m each student, teacher desk 1.5m × 0.75m, circulation ~20%

specialist_classroom_science.requirement: Laboratory benches 0.8m deep × 1.5m long × 0.8m high; 12 workstations = 120 m² minimum; also storage for equipment, fume hood (if applicable)

library_resource_room.notes: Book shelving, reading table, computer stations

bathrooms_toilets.ratio: NCC requires 1 WC per 20 students for primary, 1 per 30 for secondary (estimating 60 students total in 2-3 classroom block) = 3-4 WCs total + staff WC
bathrooms_toilets.notes: Student WCs 0.8m height accessible; staff WC separate; each WC cubicle 1.5m × 1.0m minimum (door swing 0.8m opening)

hallway_circulation.notes: Minimum 2.4m wide main corridors per NCC F2.2 (emergency egress)

storage_equipment.notes: Shelving for teaching materials, PE equipment, cleaning supplies

productivity_rates.characteristics: Similar to residential/childcare but with higher finish standards for schools; more electrical/data infrastructure required

brick_veneer_walls.notes: 5% slower than residential due to window coordination (classroom requires good daylighting per AS 1680, hence more windows, more detail)

plasterboard_fixing.notes: Junction details for noticeboard mounting, data point boxes, acoustic treatment

painting.notes: Low-VOC specification; washable interior paint for durability in school environment

items.formula: 1 WC per 20 students; for 60-student facility = 3 student WCs + 1 staff WC = 4 WC suites total
Each classroom requires minimum 1 data/network point (now standard in all schools); library 3-4 points; staff room 2 points = ~8-10 data point outlets
Each classroom: 2 whiteboards (1.5m × 1.0m each), 1 pinboard (noticeboard) = 3 classrooms × 3 boards = 9 unit boards
6 classrooms + offices + storage = ~15 doors × locks + card/key readers (modern schools require electronic access control for some areas) = ~15-20 lock sets

safety_accessibility_standards.ncc_reference: NCC 2022 Class 8, Part D (Access for people with disabilities), Part 9 (Fire safety - schools are priority)

key_requirements.occupant_load: 1 person per 2.5 m² (teaching areas) per NCC F2.3
key_requirements.exit_requirements: Minimum 2 exits from each room >75 m²; 1.0m doors minimum; travel distance to exit ≤30m per NCC F2.1
key_requirements.fire_safety_enhanced: Schools require Fire Safety Certificate (FSC); smoke alarms every 50 m² per NCC F7.1; emergency exits marked with pictograms per AS 1668
key_requirements.accessible_design_enhanced: Schools must comply with AS 1428 (Design for access and mobility) - not just minimum NCC; includes accessible staff facilities, accessible student facilities

school_specific_safety.window_safety: Upper windows (classrooms face direct sun) must have external shading or UV protection to reduce heat load (AS 4755 - outdoor sun protection); windows above 1.2m accessible height need safety film or bars
school_specific_safety.balustrade_safety: 1.1m height minimum (same as childcare) per AS 1170.1
school_specific_safety.wet_area_safety: Science labs with sinks require anti-slip floor (R10 minimum); drain covers prevent entrapment
school_specific_safety.emergency_procedures: Classroom block must have evacuation plan, assembly points marked, staff trained in emergency procedures (bushfire, lockdown, fire)

safety_accessibility_standards.accessibility_compliance: Accessible parking 1 space per 25 capacity = 2-3 accessible parking; accessible path to entrance; accessible WC (1.5m × 2.0m minimum clear space for wheelchair); accessible water fountains (height 0.8-0.9m)

formulas.calculation: (Internal walls ~120m × 2.7m × 2-sided) + Ceiling 600 m² = 648 m² + 600 m² = 1248 m² × 1.10 (waste) = 1372.8 m² plasterboard
600 m² GFA; classrooms typically carpet/vinyl (soft), wet areas tile: estimate 100 m² wet area tile × 1.10 (waste) = 110 m² tile

nrm_allocation.items: Excavation, concrete slab 94.5 m³
Timber frame, brick veneer, roof, windows (higher window-to-wall ratio for daylighting)
Plasterboard, carpet/vinyl classrooms, tile in wet areas, washable paint (higher durability)
Built-in benches (science lab), kitchen fitout (if any), noticeboards, whiteboards, shelving
Electrical (higher density: 1 point per 4 m² + data points for every classroom), plumbing (4 WCs + science lab benches with sinks), HVAC (important for classroom comfort)
Site paving, landscaping, accessible paths, parking (if required)

education_templates.name: STEM Lab
education_templates.description: Single storey STEM lab, 350m² GFA, brick veneer, tile roof, slab on ground

specifications.construction_notes: 110mm face brick + 40mm cavity + 90mm timber frame + 10mm plasterboard

measurement_assumptions.method: STEM labs (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) have specialized infrastructure requirements beyond classroom norms

main_laboratory.requirement: Lab benches 0.85m height × 1.5m length per 2 students = 12-15 bench spaces; electrical outlet every 1.5m bench length (16+ outlets just for bench power); water & drain at each bench; gas taps (if chemistry); fume hood for hazardous experiments

equipment_room.notes: Microscopes, spectrophotometers, electronic instruments storage; requires temperature control (18-25°C stable, ±2°C per equipment specs)

student_workstations.notes: Computers for data collection, analysis; CAD software stations; 8-10 workstations at 6-8 m² per station

prep_room.notes: Chemical storage, glassware washing, solution preparation; separate extraction ventilation required

storage_chemical.notes: Hazmat storage; separate from general storage; ventilated, secured, limited access (staff only)

bathrooms_emergency.notes: Emergency eyewash/shower station (AS 4775 requirement for chem labs); separate WC not always required if adjacent to main school WCs

circulation_storage.notes: Lab equipment storage, cleaning supplies, safety equipment (extinguishers, first aid)

measurement_assumptions.ceiling_height_2.8m_justification: Slightly higher than standard classroom (2.7m) to accommodate fume hood with ductwork above (hood typically 0.8m deep, duct run to roof/outside = ~1.5m from ceiling, leaving 1.3m clearance above) and overhead services (electrical, data, HVAC)

productivity_rates.characteristics: STEM labs are highest-specification educational spaces; 10-15% slower than classroom blocks due to specialized infrastructure (drainage, power, ventilation, hazmat controls)

plasterboard_fixing.notes: 10% slower than standard (45 m²/day) due to coordination around fume hood ducting, cable tray mounting, mechanical services

tiling_wet_areas.notes: Slower than standard 18-20 m²/day due to drainage detail coordination, chemical-resistant grout specification (epoxy vs standard), anti-slip requirement (R12 minimum)

electrical_installation.notes: High density power (1 outlet per 1.5m bench length = 30+ outlets just in main lab); data cabling for computer stations; specialized circuit breakers for equipment; emergency lighting/exit signs

floor_tiles.reason: Higher waste due to chemical spill zones requiring extra cuts, anti-slip edge transitions, drain grate integration

electrical_cable.reason: Higher waste (7% vs 5%) due to dense conduit runs, multiple connections, routing around equipment

items.formula: Main lab: 12-15 bench spaces × 1.5m length × 0.85m height × 0.75m depth = bespoke millwork; 50-100 linear metres of bench equivalent; supply + installation ~$500-800 per linear metre = $25-80k depending on spec
1 fume hood in prep room (typical size 1.5m wide × 0.8m deep × 1.2m height); includes ducting to roof/outside (assume 15-20m horizontal run + 5m vertical = 20-25m ductwork)
items.nrm_code: Section 5.6 (HVAC and thermal comfort) - Mechanical extract system
items.notes: Fume hood requires dedicated 400mm diameter ductwork, damper, external louvre; ~$8-15k installed (equipment + ducting + termination)

items.formula: 1 eyewash station (mounted on wall) + 1 safety shower pedestal (floor-mounted) per AS 4775 (Australian Standard for emergency eyewashes)

Main lab: 50m bench equivalent × 1 outlet per 1.5m = ~35 power outlets; student stations: 8 stations × 2 outlets = 16 outlets; prep room: 10 outlets; office: 4 outlets; total ~65 power outlets (vs classroom ~150 ÷ 4m² = ~25 points)
8-10 computer stations × 1 data point per station = 8-10 Ethernet outlets + wireless AP coverage for mobile devices; modern labs also require USB-C power delivery (integrated into data trunking)
STEM labs require 6-8 ACH (chemical fume capture) vs standard classrooms 2-4 ACH; system design for 350 m² @ 3.0m average height = 1050 m³ × 7 ACH = 7350 m³/hour capacity required

safety_accessibility_standards.section: 7 - Safety & Accessibility (NCC Class 8 - STEM Labs, Hazmat-Aware)
safety_accessibility_standards.ncc_reference: NCC 2022 Class 8 + AS 4775 (Emergency eyewashes), AS 1668 (The Use of Ventilation), AS 1928 (Pressure equipment)

key_requirements.hazard_assessment: STEM labs must have formal risk assessment per Australian Dangerous Goods Code (if using hazardous chemicals); lab safety manual required
key_requirements.ventilation_extraction: Fume hood extraction system with dedicated outdoor air supply (AS 1668) - not recirculated; minimum 0.5 m/s face velocity in fume hood, 6-8 ACH room air changes
key_requirements.chemical_storage: AS 3745 requires segregated storage by chemical class (acids, bases, organics, oxidizers); secured cabinet, spill containment secondary tray
key_requirements.emergency_equipment: Eyewash station within 15m of any work area per AS 4775; emergency safety shower if used chemicals >1kg; fire extinguisher (dry powder or CO2 for electrical fires) near electrical panels
key_requirements.personal_protective_equipment: Lab coats, safety glasses (impact-resistant), closed-toe shoes required; storage cubbies for PPE near entrance

safety_accessibility_standards.environmental_compliance: Wastewater from lab sinks requires pre-treatment (clarifier + pH adjustment) before entering main school drainage per NCC F8 (WATER); no hazardous disposal down drain

formulas.calculation: (Internal walls ~100m × 2.8m × 2-sided) + Ceiling 350 m² = 560 m² + 350 m² = 910 m² × 1.10 (waste) = 1001 m² plasterboard
Main lab 120 m² + prep 20 m² + storage 12 m² = 152 m² tile × 1.12 (waste, including transitions) = 170.2 m²

nrm_allocation.items: Concrete slab 55 m³ + reinforcement for heavy benches/equipment
Plasterboard, chemical-resistant flooring (high-spec tile), sealed/painted surfaces
Lab benches (custom millwork), fume hood cabinetry, storage cabinets (hazmat-rated), shelving

Electrical (65+ outlets, high-capacity distribution); plumbing (bench drains, eyewash, emergency shower, wastewater pre-treatment); HVAC (7350 m³/hr extraction system); gas supply (if Bunsen burners/equipment)
Fume hood extraction ductwork, pre-fabricated emergency shower station
Ventilation termination (roof ductwork exit, louvre), site drainage (wastewater treatment outfall)

structural_system_notes.section: 9 - Structural System & Ceiling Height (2.8m for Equipment)
structural_system_notes.ceiling_height_derivation: 2.8m (vs 2.7m classroom) accommodates: fume hood 0.8m + ductwork space 0.5m + electrical/data tray 0.2m + structural soffit 0.3m = 1.8m occupied space, leaving 1.0m clear working height above (adequate for lab technician standing at bench ~1.7m tall)

summary_and_notes.document_purpose: This comprehensive template package (9 buildings, ~3000 lines) provides complete measurement assumptions, derivation formulas, productivity standards, waste factors, and NRM mapping for industrial and education construction in Australia.
key_deliverables: 3 education templates: childcare centre, classroom block, STEM laboratory
9 measurement assumption sections per template (hybrid sizing, productivity, waste, non-linear items, soil/safety, derivations, accessibility, NRM mapping, structural notes)
Explicit waste factors in ALL derivation formulas (Australian industry standard compliance)
Conservative productivity rates with gang size modifiers and site condition context
NRM Level 2 code mapping for each item and section allocation percentages
australian_standards_compliance: NCC 2022 (Volumes 1-2): ceiling heights, room dimensions, exits, fire safety, accessibility
AS 1684 (Timber Structures): residential framing + non-cyclonic design
AS 1580 (Paints): low-VOC specifications for educational facilities
Masonry Contractors Australia Productivity Guide 2019: bricklaying rates (5.78 m²/person/day baseline)
Rawlinsons Construction Handbook 2025: material costs, regional adjustments
AS 4775 (Emergency eyewash stations): STEM lab requirement
AS 1668 (Ventilation): STEM lab air change rates (6-8 ACH)
industrial_highlights: Hybrid volume-based sizing (length × width × height) for large-volume items like concrete slabs, steel frames
Ceiling height variance: 5.0-7.5m (vs residential 2.7m) driven by pallet racking/equipment requirements
Productivity gains from repetitive work (metal cladding, portal frames); 2-3 person teams vs residential 3-person baseline
Lower waste factors for steel (1.05 prefab) vs concrete (1.05 spillage/settling)
Non-linear items: loading docks (count-based), mezzanines (optional), drainage perimeters (linear-based)
Soil condition modifiers (clay 1.0, sand 0.8, rock 2.5x, fill 0.9, mixed 1.3x) impact excavation cost ±25%
NRM Section 2 (Superstructure) dominates industrial at 25-35% (steel frame, cladding, roof)
education_highlights: Room dimensions per child/student ratio: childcare 3.25 m²/child (infant), 2.5 m²/child (toddler/preschool); classrooms 2.0 m²/student
Non-linear items: bathrooms per child ratio, electrical outlets per room type, safety barriers (linear metres)
Safety standards enhanced vs residential: NCC Class 8, AS 1428 accessibility (voluntary), window restrictor bars, low-VOC paint specification
STEM labs: specialized infrastructure (fume hood extraction, 65+ power outlets, high-density data, 7350 m³/hr ventilation capacity)
Productivity slightly slower (5-10%) due to fit-out precision and safety documentation requirements
NRM Section 5 (Services) dominates education at 18-35% (electrical, plumbing, HVAC infrastructure exceeds residential proportionally)
summary_and_notes.derivation_format_mandatory: Every quantity derivation explicitly shows waste factor as mandatory per Australian industry standard. Format: `Base Quantity × Rate × Waste Factor (% explanation) = Final Quantity`

version_control.standards_cutoff: NCC 2022, Rawlinsons Edition 43 (2025), Masonry Contractors Australia Productivity Guide 2019
version_control.next_review: 2026-07-01 (H1 review cycle to align with Rawlinsons quarterly updates)
version_control.applicable_regions: Australia (all states/territories); regional cost adjustments applied via Rawlinsons indices per location
